clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Care for Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease Using EMRALD
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Care for Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease Using Electronic Medical Record Interventions: A Pragmatic Cluster Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This pragmatic cluster randomized controlled trial will test the impact of feedback and a toolkit aimed at improving the management of chronic kidney disease (CKD) in the primary care setting. This trial will use family physicians in Ontario participating in the Electronic.

detailed_description.textblock: This trial will use family physicians in Ontario participating in the Electronic Medical Record Administrative data Linked Database (EMRALD) and receiving the System for Audit and Feedback to Improve caRE (SAFIRE) along with other decision support tools. Performance on CKD quality indicators for family physicians receiving the CKD feedback and tools will be compared to physicians not receiving the CKD feedback or tools.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients age 50-80 with Stage 3+ CKD and a statin prescription
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of proportion of patients age 50-80 years with Stage 3+ CKD (no dialysis or renal transplant) and receiving a statin prescription at baseline and at the end of the trial

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients at high risk screened for CKD with an eGFR and/or ACR
secondary_outcome.description: compare baseline rates to end of intervention rates

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with an initial eGFR <60 and a f/u eGFR or an ACR
secondary_outcome.description: compare baseline rates to end of intervention rates

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with diabetes and albuminuria and on an ACE or ARB
secondary_outcome.description: compare baseline rates to end of intervention rates

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients meeting eGFR criteria for CKD and documentation of CKD in the cumulative patient profile (CPP)
secondary_outcome.description: compare baseline rates to end of intervention rates

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with an ACR in the past 18 months and meeting bp targets
secondary_outcome.description: compare baseline rates to end of intervention rates

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients age less than 80 years and an eGFR<30 being seen by or with a referral to a Nephrologist
secondary_outcome.description: compare baseline rates to end of intervention rates

arm_group.description: Physicians in these clinics/clusters will receive feedback on their performance for screening and managing CKD quality indicators as well as EMR tools to aid in their performance
Physicians in these clinics/clusters will not receive CKD feedback or tools

intervention.description: people in the intervention arm will receive feedback on ckd quality indicators and tools to help in the detection and management of ckd

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Family physicians participating in EMRALD, on the EMR for >=2 years, roster size >=100 patients
- Patient criteria, rostered and actively seeing an EMRALD physician, on the EMR for .=1 year
Exclusion Criteria:
- Updated data available at the time of study commencement

patient_data.ipd_description: No, final results will be aggregate although as part of the trial individual participants do receive individual level feedback
